value:
The name of the game is making
money. Money is all that matters.
When will that little urchin learn?

Trying to find a worthy prince who's
willing to take Princess L'Arachel?
Dozla has his work cut out for him.

Colm thinks we're alike because he
was forced to do a little gardening?
Hah. I'll show him what real work is.

Merchants are stingy. It's who they
are. My father was especially stingy.
He gave me nothing for free.

I prefer to earn rewards that aren't
for the taking, if you catch my drift.
I won't pull a muscle trying, though.

Granted, Princess L'Arachel is worse,
but I landed with a real taskmaster
when I met $Nf.

You'll never beat me with skills like
that. You're greener than the fruit
I left out for a month.

Slow... slow... quick, quick, slow...
Too bad battle is not akin to
dancing with a beautiful woman...

These people respect my abilities
and value my skills... Well, at least
I hope that's still the case...

Mercenaries fight to get paid, simple
as that. So it's nothing personal if
I don't stick around, OK?

I'm Rennac of Carcino. I beg your
indulgence, and a fair bit of gold,
should you choose to employ me.

*sigh* Oh. Apologies. I was told by
a rather noisy companion that it's
rude to sigh when you see someone.$k$pHeh. She also asked me what makes
me happy. I hadn't ever given it much
thought until then, if I'm honest.$k$pShe told me to treasure what I do
possess instead of lamenting what
I don't. I know she meant well, but...$k$pI'm the son of a Carcino merchant.
I grew up believing you could move
the world if you had enough gold.$k$pBah, I shouldn't complain. This isn't
what I'm paid to worry about. I'll just
try to make the best of it.
やっ
それっ
ぐっ
You've gotta be kidding...
Too easy.
I hate working for free.
Got any gold?
I think I'll just scamper off.
Just what I needed...
Ugh...
The name's Rennac. I'm a world-class thief, and proud of it.
Do you see this jacket? It has silk embroidery. The truly cultured man cares about every detail.
They say Prince Ephraim hoards money like a starving beast with a fresh kill.
The name of the game is making money. Money is all that matters.
I thought working for a princess would pay well.
Hey, you haven't clapped eyes on Princess L'Arachel, have you?
I'm a useful fellow to have around. And cheap, too! Only 9,980 gold!
You're the boss.
You can't be serious!
Very good!
